content.value_statement: Ensure consistent code quality across Python projects. This skill automates formatting with Black, linting with Ruff, and type checking with BasedPyright to maintain professional code standards.
actual_capabilities: Format Python code with Black and Ruff
Run linting checks with Ruff PyStrict rules
Perform type checking with BasedPyright strict mode
Apply blind except and error message best practices
limitations: Requires Python project with uv package manager
Does not fix issues automatically without user approval
Assumes pre-commit configuration is already set up

best_practices: Run quality checks before committing code to catch issues early
Use BasedPyright strict mode to catch type errors at development time
Configure pre-commit hooks to automate quality checks on every commit
anti_patterns: Skipping linting checks because they seem overly strict
Ignoring type checker warnings without understanding them
Running pre-commit hooks only after noticing a CI failure

faq.question: Does this skill support languages other than Python?
faq.answer: No, this skill is specifically designed for Python projects using Black, Ruff, and BasedPyright.

faq.question: What happens if pre-commit hooks fail?
faq.answer: The skill reports which hooks failed and why. You must fix the issues before committing.

faq.question: Can I customize the linting rules?
faq.answer: Yes, modify your pyproject.toml to adjust Ruff rules. This skill uses PyStrict defaults.

faq.question: Is my code sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. All tools run locally on your machine. No code leaves your development environment.

faq.question: Why are some type errors ignored in tests?
faq.answer: Tests may have relaxed rules for pragmatic development. Adjust per-file ignores in pyproject.toml.

faq.question: How is this different from running tools manually?
faq.answer: This skill provides a unified interface and guides you through the complete quality workflow.
